hero.heading: Durability & Impact
hero.copy: From hurricane debris to the decibels of a passing airplane, there are ways to measure what can get through your door.
hero.direction: Things to consider while you shop

inspiration.heading: Cancel out the noise.
copy: The number of panes, types of coating and layers of insulation all factor into how much noise can travel through your door. A door’s Sound Transmission Class (STC) rating tells you how many decibels make it past the threshold.

inspiration.heading: Keep your A/C inside.
copy: Invest in your new entryway with protective weather strips on the top and sides and a sweep at the bottom. You can also invest in a best-in-class door sill for a strong seal that keeps moisture out and your air conditioning inside.

inspiration.heading: Be ready for Mother Nature.
copy: If you live in a coastal area, your building code might require that your entry door be able to withstand impact from severe weather. Each impact-rated door, frame, and glass panel is reinforced so that damage from wind and debris is minimized.

next.heading: Now let’s take a look at your safety and security options.
next.copy: From locks to fire-resistance, you don’t ever have to second guess your entry door’s security.
